channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Could polio be poised for a comeback?
item.description: Cases have been rising in Afghanistan and Pakistan — and global health specialists are worried that this year's U.S. foreign aid cuts could usher in a wider resurgence.
item.content:encoded:
Cases have been rising in Afghanistan and Pakistan — and global health specialists are worried that this year's U.S. foreign aid cuts could usher in a wider resurgence.

(Image credit: Asif Hassan)
item.dc:creator: Betsy Joles

item.title: Trump aims to lower drug prices. And, Harvard's tax-exempt status threatened
item.description: Trump has signed an executive action aimed at lowering prescription drug prices. And, the president threatened to revoke Harvard University's tax-exempt status after it rejected government demands.
item.content:encoded:
Trump has signed an executive action aimed at lowering prescription drug prices. And, the president threatened to revoke Harvard University's tax-exempt status after it rejected government demands.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Study highlights cancer risk from millions of CT scans performed annually
item.description: They can be life-saving but radiation from the scans also contributes to cancer risk. The authors of a new study estimate overuse of CT scans is increasing the U.S. cancer burden.
item.content:encoded:
They can be life-saving but radiation from the scans also contributes to cancer risk. The authors of a new study estimate overuse of CT scans is increasing the U.S. cancer burden.

(Image credit: kckate16/iStockphoto)
item.dc:creator: Ronnie Cohen

item.title: Photos: Scientists trace a butterfly migration route that is millions of years old
item.description: Scientists have recently mapped the painted lady butterfly's annual flight from equatorial Africa to northern Europe and back, the world's longest butterfly migration. In Constant Bloom, photographer Lucas Foglia documents the journey.
item.content:encoded:
Scientists have recently mapped the painted lady butterfly's annual flight from equatorial Africa to northern Europe and back, the world's longest butterfly migration. In Constant Bloom, photographer Lucas Foglia documents the journey.

(Image credit: Lucas Foglia)
item.dc:creator: Natalie Escobar

item.title: How psychiatric patients get caught in a cycle of homelessness and spotty care
item.description: Montana is investing $300 million to help those with severe mental illness from cycling through ERs, state psychiatric facilities, jails and homelessness. Advocates say they also need stable housing.
item.content:encoded:
Montana is investing $300 million to help those with severe mental illness from cycling through ERs, state psychiatric facilities, jails and homelessness. Advocates say they also need stable housing.

(Image credit: Aaron Bolton)
item.dc:creator: Aaron Bolton

item.title: Families say school civil rights investigations have stalled after federal cuts
item.description: The U.S. Education Department's Office for Civil Rights investigates discrimination in schools. It recently lost more than 40% of its staff.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. Education Department's Office for Civil Rights investigates discrimination in schools. It recently lost more than 40% of its staff.

(Image credit: Kaiti Sullivan for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Dylan Peers McCoy

item.title: Word of the Week: Coachella began as a typo. Here's what happened next
item.description: When you think of Coachella, you probably picture the festival. But there's much more to know about the place it calls home.
item.content:encoded:
When you think of Coachella, you probably picture the festival. But there's much more to know about the place it calls home.

(Image credit: Frazer Harrison)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Wink Martindale, the genial game show host and early interviewer of Elvis, dies at 91
item.description: The legendary TV host of game shows "Tic-Tac-Dough" and "Gambit" died at his home in Rancho Mirage, California. He had been battling lymphoma for a year.
item.content:encoded:
The legendary TV host of game shows "Tic-Tac-Dough" and "Gambit" died at his home in Rancho Mirage, California. He had been battling lymphoma for a year.

(Image credit: Richard Shotwell)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: U.K. high court says trans women don't meet definition of women under equalities law
item.description: Justice Patrick Hodge said five judges at the court had ruled unanimously that "the terms 'woman' and 'sex' in the Equality Act refer to a biological woman and biological sex."
item.content:encoded:
Justice Patrick Hodge said five judges at the court had ruled unanimously that "the terms 'woman' and 'sex' in the Equality Act refer to a biological woman and biological sex."

(Image credit: Frank Augstein)
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: Hong Kong post office will stop shipping parcels to the U.S. over tariffs
item.description: Hong Kong is caught in the middle of the trade disputes between the U.S. and China despite being a free port. The former British colony has trade and customs policies different from mainland China's.
item.content:encoded:
Hong Kong is caught in the middle of the trade disputes between the U.S. and China despite being a free port. The former British colony has trade and customs policies different from mainland China's.

(Image credit: Chan Long Hei)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
